Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by any evidence or source.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the New York Post used the headline "YOU'RE FIRED" on Nov. 4 with an image of Donald Trump, without providing any evidence or verification.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the New York Post did not use the headline "YOU'RE FIRED" on Nov. 4, as confirmed by the actual Nov. 4 cover of the newspaper.
Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the significance of a fake cover circulating on social media, suggesting that it represents the New York Post's stance on Donald Trump.
Understate: No understatement bias is evident in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting information that is not directly related to the alleged New York Post cover, such as the quote about the national nightmare being over and references to other New York Post covers.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias in the claim.
